title: Orthologous MAtrix (OMA) RDF
description: The OMA (Orthologous MAtrix) project is a method and database for the inference of orthologs among complete genomes. The OMA RDF is a view of the OMA database in RDF.

title: Medical Subject Headings (MeSH) RDF Dataset Description
description: A linked data representation of the MeSH biomedical vocabulary produced by the National Library of Medicine.

title: dbVar
description: dbVar is NCBI's database of human genomic Structural Variation — large variants >50 bp including insertions, deletions, duplications, inversions, mobile elements, translocations, and complex variants

title: GTDB
description: The Genome Taxonomy Database

title: FAMSBASE GPCR
description: RDFized reference gene expresson dataset derived from CAGE and GeneChip experiments in the RefEx database.

title: ClinVar RDF
description: ClinVar is a freely available archive describing relationships between medically important variants and phenotypes.

title: HomoloGene RDF
description: HomoloGene RDF is a translation of HomoloGene data into RDF.

title: PubTator Central
description: Automatic annotations of biomedical concepts such as genes and mutations in PubMed abstracts and PMC full-text

title: RDF title
description: RDF description.

title: Gene Ontology
description: The Gene Ontology resource provides a computational representation of our current scientific knowledge about the functions of genes (or, more properly, the protein and non-coding RNA molecules produced by genes) from many different organisms, from humans to bacteria.

title: dbscSNV
description: a comprehensive database of all potential human SNVs within splicing consensus regions and their functional annotations

title: Nikkaji RDF
description: NBDC NikkajiRDF is RDF data of Japan Chemical Substance Dictionary (Nikkaji), which is one of the largest chemical substance databases in Japan.

title: Integbio Database Catalog/RDF
description: Integbio Database Catalog/RDF is a translation of Integbio Database Catalog data into RDF

title: Bgee
description: A database for retrieval and comparison of gene expression patterns across multiple animal species

title: MedGen
description: MedGen organizes Information related to human medical genetics, such as attributes of conditions with a genetic contribution.

title: RDF title
description: RDF description.

title: DBKERO RDF
description: DBKERO is a collection of multi-omics data sets including SNV, RNA-seq, ChIP-seq, BS-seq and TSS-seq. The ChIP-seq part is big, so its lite version chip_seq_lite is included. The original big ChIP-seq data can also be downloaded at https://integbio.jp/rdf/download/kero/2017-01-27/all/chip_seq_all.tar.gz .

title: SRA Experiment RDF
description: SRA Experiment RDF developed by DBCLS and distributed by DDBJ

title: Metadata of JCM resources
description: A RDF-based meta-database of microbial strains used in various researches such as biology, environment and human health as bioresources. Microbial strains are available from Japan Collection of Microorganisms (JCM) in RIKEN BioResource Center. Please visit data browser at http://metadb.riken.jp/metadb/db/rikenbrc_jcm_microbe

title: NLM Catalog
description: NLM bibliographic data on journals, books, audiovisual materials, computer software, electronic resources, and other materials

title: KNApSAcK RDF
description: RDFized dataset in the KNApSAcK family database.
Meta-information of quantitative data and datasets of microscopy images provided from SSBD database

title: BRENDA RDF
description: BRENDA is the comprehensive enzyme information system with data on enzyme function, structure, and kinetics.

title: PolyInfo BDG_S, ID definition
description: NIMS polymer database PoLyInfo-Bio Linkage Project, Definition of biodegradation IDs and linking schemas for synthetic polymers.

title: DisGeNET RDF
description: DisGeNET is a collection of genes and variants associated to human diseases, which integrates data from expert curated repositories, GWAS catalogues, animal models and the scientific literature.

title: RDF title
description: RDF description.

title: Dataset of NARO Genebank Microorganism Bioresource
description: A dataset for microbes which are maintained, managed and provided from Genebank Project, NARO.

title: RDF title
description: RDF description.

title: HGNC\: The resource for approved human gene nomenclature
description: The HGNC is a resource for approved human gene nomenclature containing ~42000 gene

title: ChEBI RDF
description: ChEBI (Chemical Entities of Biological Interest) is a freely accessible, ontology-driven database of ‘small molecular entities’, including their chemical structures, names, definitions, roles, and biological relationships. It provides manually curated, non-proprietary data supported by links to external resources and is widely used in chemical biology and bioinformatics

title: BMRB/RDF
description: BMRB/RDF is a translation of NMR-STAR data into RDF

title: NANDO
description: NANDO is a vocabulary that systematically and comprehensively organizes designated intractable diseases and pediatric chronic specific diseases, including their subtypes. Each disease in NANDO is linked to Mondo (Monarch Disease Ontology), a disease vocabulary adopted by many international databases and systems, enabling integration with major international disease databases such as OMIM and Orphanet.

title: Ensembl RDF
description: Ensembl is a collection of automatically annotated genome databases for vertebrates and a number of eukaryotes, integrated with all other relevant biological data available.

title: TogoID RDF
description: TogoID is a service to search and convert links between database identifiers.

title: BacDive RDF
description: BacDive is the worldwide largest knowledgebase for standardized bacterial information.

title: jPOST databse RDF
description: jPOST database RDF is described the re-analyzed proteome dataset in the jPOST project.

title: RDF title
description: RDF description.

title: RefEx RDF
description: RDFized reference gene expresson dataset derived from CAGE and GeneChip experiments in the RefEx database.

title: GlyCosmos
description: RDF description.

title: MediaDive RDF
description: MediaDive is the largest collection of cultivation media and growth conditions.

title: ChEMBL RDF
description: ChEMBL is a manually curated database of bioactive molecules with drug-like properties.

title: UniProt RDF
description: The Universal Protein Resource (UniProt) is a comprehensive resource for protein sequence and annotation data.

title: PubMed
description: PubMed comprises more than 30 million citations for biomedical literature from MEDLINE, life science journals,

title: dbNSFP
description: dbNSFP is a database developed for functional prediction and annotation of all potential non-synonymous single-nucleotide variants (nsSNVs) in the human genome.

title: GlyTouCan
description: GlyTouCan is the international glycan structure repository.

title: Mondo Disease Ontology
description: The Mondo Disease Ontology (MONDO) is a harmonized, logic-based disease classification that unifies and standardizes terminology across diverse medical sources by integrating mappings (with precise semantics) from databases such as OMIM, Orphanet, SNOMED CT, and ICD

title: DDBJ
description: Semantic Representation of DDBJ Annotated Sequence Records.

title: Dataset of NBRC bioresource
description: Dataset of NBRC bioresource is a dataset for microbes which are maintained, managed and provided from NBRC (NITE Biological Resource Center).

title: Nucleic Acid Drug Database
description: DB is focused on nucleic acid drugs known as biopharmaceuticals and displayed approval drugs and information on three phases of clinical trial stage.

title: Rhea
description: An expert curated resource of biochemical reactions designed for the annotation of enzymes and genome-scale metabolic networks and models.

title: RDF title
description: RDF description.

title: PubChem RDF
description: PubChem is an open chemistry database at the National Institutes of Health (NIH). For the detailed information, please see the following URL\: https\://pubchemdocs.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/about. \Note\: The endpoint does not include files provided at ftp\://ftp.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/pubchem/RDF/compound/nbr2d/ and ftp\://ftp.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/pubchem/RDF/compound/nbr3d/\

title: Open TG-GATEs
description: Open TG-GATEs is a public toxicogenomics database

title: RefEx RDF
description: RDFized reference gene expresson dataset derived from CAGE and GeneChip experiments in the RefEx database.

title: Quanto RDF
description: Raw sequence data quality statistics calculated from the Sequence Read Archive data

title: NCBI Gene RDF
description: NCBI Gene RDF is a translation of NCBI Gene data into RDF.

title: PubCaseFinder RDF
description: PubCaseFinder (PCF) is a Human Phenotype Ontology (HPO)-based clinical decision support system for rare and genetic diseases, always up-to-date.

title: BioSample RDF
description: BioSample RDF developed by DBCLS and distributed by DDBJ

title: ChIP-Atlas RDF
description: ChIP-Atlas RDF developed by DBCLS

title: Reactome RDF
description: REACTOME is an open-source, open access, manually curated and peer-reviewed pathway database.

title: GGDonto
description: GGDonto is the Ontology of the Genetic Diseases related to the Glycan Metabolism. GGDonto describes the knowledge about Congenital Disorders of Glycosylation (CDG) and Lysosomal Storage Diseases (LSD). GGDonto provides the information on 120 genetic diseases of the glycan synthesis and the degradation and their causative genes.

title: GlycoEpitope
description: GlycoEpitope is a database of useful information on carbohydrate antigens and antibodies.
